events.title: Workshop on Indigenous Trees of Tamil Nadu

location.address: 123 Green Avenue, R.S. Puram, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu 641002

description.brief: Learn about ancient Tamil indigenous trees and their ecological importance through hands-on activities.
description.full: This comprehensive workshop explores indigenous tree species mentioned in Tamil Sangam literature. Participants will learn identification techniques, ecological significance, and conservation methods. The session includes interactive presentations, hands-on activities, and field demonstrations led by expert botanists.
objectives: Identify 10+ indigenous tree species native to Tamil Nadu
Understand ecological roles of native trees in local ecosystems
Learn traditional propagation and cultivation techniques
Explore cultural significance in Tamil literature and heritage
activities: Morning session: Tree identification walkthrough in VEFS botanical garden
Afternoon: Propagation techniques demonstration and practice
Q&A session with expert botanists and ecologists

facilitators.name: Dr. Rajesh Kumar
facilitators.title: Environmental Scientist & Botanist
facilitators.bio: 20+ years experience in native tree conservation and ecological research

requirements.prerequisites: None - Open to all interested learners
whatToBring: Hat or cap for outdoor activities
requirements.dressCode: Comfortable outdoor clothing and closed-toe shoes

events.cancellationPolicy: Free cancellation up to 2 days before event. Cancellations within 2 days are subject to availability for rescheduling.

events.title: Community Tree Plantation Drive

location.address: Siruvani Hills Road, Coimbatore West, Tamil Nadu

events.targetAudience: Community members and families interested in environmental action

description.brief: Join us for a community-driven tree plantation event to plant 500+ indigenous saplings in Siruvani foothills.
description.full: Republic Day special event! Join VEFS Foundation in our mission to restore local biodiversity by planting 500+ indigenous tree saplings. This community event brings together volunteers of all ages to contribute to reforestation efforts while learning about native species and their ecological importance.
objectives: Plant 500+ indigenous tree saplings
Create awareness about reforestation and biodiversity
Build community engagement in environmental conservation
Document and tag planted trees for future monitoring

facilitators.name: Mr. Senthil Kumar
facilitators.title: Field Coordinator, VEFS
facilitators.bio: 10 years experience organizing community plantation drives across Tamil Nadu

requirements.dressCode: Old clothes suitable for outdoor work, sturdy shoes

logistics.transportation: Shuttle buses from VEFS office at 6:30 AM

events.cancellationPolicy: Free cancellation up to 1 day before event

events.title: Organic Farming Awareness Seminar

location.address: Tamil Nadu Agricultural University Campus, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu 641003

events.targetAudience: Farmers interested in transitioning to organic farming practices

description.brief: Comprehensive seminar on organic farming techniques, sustainable practices, and government support schemes for farmers.
description.full: This seminar brings together organic farming experts, successful organic farmers, and government officials to discuss the benefits, challenges, and practical steps for transitioning to organic agriculture. Attendees will learn about soil health management, natural pest control, certification processes, and market opportunities for organic produce.
objectives: Understand principles and benefits of organic farming
Learn practical techniques for organic cultivation
Explore government schemes and subsidies for organic farmers
Network with successful organic farmers and experts
activities: Keynote address by renowned organic farming expert
Panel discussion with successful organic farmers
Government schemes presentation by Agriculture Department

facilitators.name: Dr. Priya Devi
facilitators.title: Soil Scientist & Organic Farming Consultant
facilitators.bio: PhD in Soil Science with 15 years of organic farming research and consultancy

facilitators.name: Mr. Murugan Natarajan
facilitators.title: Award-winning Organic Farmer
facilitators.bio: 25 years of organic farming experience, recipient of State Agriculture Award 2023

requirements.prerequisites: Current or aspiring farmers with basic farming knowledge

logistics.transportation: College is well-connected by public transport

events.cancellationPolicy: 50% refund if cancelled 3+ days before event, no refund for cancellations within 3 days

events.title: Nature Photography Competition & Exhibition

location.address: Race Course Road, Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu 641018

events.targetAudience: Amateur and professional photographers passionate about nature

description.brief: Annual nature photography competition showcasing biodiversity, indigenous flora/fauna with cash prizes and exhibition.
description.full: VEFS presents its 3rd Annual Nature Photography Competition celebrating the beauty and diversity of Tamil Nadu's natural heritage. Photographers can submit entries across multiple categories including Indigenous Trees, Wildlife, Landscapes, and Macro Nature. Winning entries will be exhibited and winners receive cash prizes and certificates.
objectives: Promote nature photography as a conservation tool
Showcase Tamil Nadu's biodiversity through visual storytelling
Recognize and reward talented photographers
Create public awareness through photo exhibition
activities: Judging by panel of photography experts

facilitators.name: Mr. Arun Krishnan
facilitators.title: Wildlife Photographer & Jury Member
facilitators.bio: International award-winning wildlife photographer with 20+ years experience

requirements.prerequisites: Own camera or smartphone, passion for nature photography

logistics.transportation: Central location, well-connected by public transport

events.cancellationPolicy: Entry fee non-refundable after submission deadline

events.title: Seed Preservation Workshop for Women
events.targetAudience: Women farmers and homemakers interested in seed preservation

description.brief: Learn traditional and modern seed preservation techniques to maintain indigenous crop varieties.
description.full: This hands-on workshop empowers women with knowledge and skills for preserving indigenous seeds. Participants will learn traditional storage methods, seed viability testing, and the importance of maintaining genetic diversity in crops. The workshop includes practical demonstrations and each participant receives a seed preservation starter kit.
objectives: Understand importance of seed preservation for food security
Master traditional seed storage techniques
Learn to identify and collect high-quality seeds
Build a home seed bank for kitchen garden use
activities: Introduction to seed preservation and biodiversity
Demonstration of seed cleaning and drying methods
Hands-on practice with various seed types
Distribution of seed preservation starter kits

facilitators.name: Mrs. Lakshmi Raman
facilitators.title: Traditional Seed Keeper & Trainer
facilitators.bio: 30+ years maintaining indigenous seed varieties, women's empowerment advocate

requirements.prerequisites: Interest in gardening and seed preservation

events.cancellationPolicy: Free cancellation up to 1 day before event

description.brief: Annual celebration featuring cultural programs, eco-stalls, children's activities, and environmental pledge.
description.full: VEFS Foundation's grand celebration of World Environment Day featured eco-friendly stalls, cultural performances, children's painting competition, sapling distribution, and environmental awareness programs. The event successfully brought together 480+ participants from across the city for a day of learning, celebration, and environmental commitment.
objectives: Celebrate World Environment Day with community
Distribute 1000+ saplings to participants
Create environmental awareness through activities
Engage children in eco-friendly art and games
activities: Evening: Prize distribution and closing ceremony

facilitators.name: VEFS Team
facilitators.title: Event Coordinators
facilitators.bio: Dedicated team of volunteers and staff members

events.title: Eco-trekking: Western Ghats Biodiversity Exploration
events.targetAudience: Nature enthusiasts and adventure seekers aged 16+

description.brief: Guided eco-trek through Western Ghats exploring biodiversity hotspots, endemic species, and conservation zones.
description.full: Experience the rich biodiversity of the Western Ghats UNESCO World Heritage Site through this guided eco-trek. Led by experienced naturalists, participants will explore montane forests, identify endemic flora and fauna, learn about conservation efforts, and witness breathtaking landscapes. This moderate-difficulty trek includes bird watching, plant identification, and environmental education.
objectives: Experience Western Ghats biodiversity firsthand
Learn to identify endemic plant and animal species
Understand conservation challenges in the region
Practice responsible eco-tourism principles

facilitators.name: Mr. Karthik Sundar
facilitators.title: Wildlife Biologist & Trek Leader
facilitators.bio: Certified naturalist with 12 years experience leading eco-treks in Western Ghats

requirements.prerequisites: Moderate fitness level, prior trekking experience helpful but not required
requirements.dressCode: Comfortable trekking clothes in earth tones, full pants and full sleeves recommended

logistics.transportation: Bus transport from VEFS office at 5:30 AM, return by 7 PM

events.cancellationPolicy: 50% refund if cancelled 5+ days before trek, no refund within 5 days

events.title: Online Webinar: Climate Change & Agriculture

location.address: Online - Zoom link will be shared via email

events.targetAudience: Farmers, students, and anyone interested in climate-resilient agriculture

description.brief: Expert discussion on climate change impacts on agriculture and adaptive farming strategies for Tamil Nadu.
description.full: Join this free online webinar featuring agricultural scientists, climate experts, and farmers discussing the real-world impacts of climate change on farming in Tamil Nadu. Learn about climate-resilient crop varieties, water management strategies, and government support programs. Interactive Q&A session included.
objectives: Understand climate change impacts on Tamil Nadu agriculture
Learn climate-resilient farming techniques
Discover government schemes for climate adaptation
Hear success stories from adaptive farmers
activities: Case studies from Tamil Nadu farmers

facilitators.name: Dr. Anitha Ravi
facilitators.title: Climate Scientist, Agricultural University
facilitators.bio: Research focus on climate-resilient agriculture for tropical regions

requirements.prerequisites: None - Open to all interested participants

events.title: School Tree Planting Competition - District Level

description.brief: Inter-school competition where student teams plant trees, create awareness campaigns, and compete for prizes.
description.full: District-level tree planting competition brought together 60 schools with 285 students participating in team-based challenges. Schools competed in categories including: Most trees planted, Best awareness campaign, Creative eco-posters, and Environmental quiz. The event successfully planted 1,200+ saplings across designated zones.
objectives: Engage schools in environmental action
Plant 1000+ trees across competition zones
Create student-led awareness campaigns
Foster environmental leadership among youth

facilitators.name: Ms. Divya Shankar
facilitators.title: School Program Coordinator, VEFS
facilitators.bio: 5 years coordinating environmental programs for schools

requirements.prerequisites: Must be registered school student, parental consent required

events.cancellationPolicy: School-based registration - Contact organizers for changes

events.title: Composting & Waste Management for Homes
events.targetAudience: Homeowners and apartment residents interested in waste management

description.brief: Practical workshop on setting up home composting systems and reducing household waste through sustainable practices.
description.full: Learn to convert kitchen waste into valuable compost for your garden through this hands-on workshop. Participants will understand different composting methods suitable for apartments and independent houses, learn to troubleshoot common issues, and receive guidance on setting up their own composting system. Each participant receives a composting starter kit.
objectives: Understand benefits of home composting
Learn various composting methods (aerobic, vermicompost, bokashi)
Master waste segregation techniques
Set up functional home composting system
activities: Starter kit distribution and setup guidance

facilitators.name: Mr. Vijay Prakash
facilitators.title: Zero Waste Consultant
facilitators.bio: 10 years promoting household waste management and urban composting

requirements.prerequisites: Interest in waste management and composting

logistics.transportation: RWA hall in residential area, easily accessible

events.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 2+ days before event

events.title: Medicinal Plants Identification & Cultivation
events.targetAudience: Nature enthusiasts, students, and people interested in traditional medicine

description.brief: Comprehensive workshop on identifying, cultivating, and using common medicinal plants from Ayurvedic and Siddha traditions.
description.full: Discover the world of traditional Indian medicinal plants through this immersive workshop. Learn to identify 25+ medicinal plants, understand their therapeutic properties, cultivation requirements, and sustainable harvesting practices. Participants will receive seeds/cuttings of medicinal plants and a detailed identification guide.
objectives: Identify common medicinal plants used in Ayurveda and Siddha
Understand cultivation and care requirements
Learn sustainable harvesting and processing methods
Create a home medicinal garden plan
activities: Guided tour of VEFS medicinal plant garden

facilitators.name: Dr. Meenakshi Sundaram
facilitators.title: Siddha Medicine Practitioner & Botanist
facilitators.bio: 25 years experience in traditional medicine and medicinal plant cultivation

requirements.prerequisites: Interest in medicinal plants and traditional medicine

logistics.accessibility: Garden paths may be uneven - wheelchair access limited
logistics.transportation: On main road, public transport available

events.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 3+ days before event

events.title: Farmer-Scientist Interaction: Sustainable Practices
events.targetAudience: Small and marginal farmers from Coimbatore district

description.brief: Bridging the gap between farmers and agricultural scientists through dialogue, knowledge sharing, and practical demonstrations.
description.full: This successful event brought together 76 farmers and agricultural scientists for meaningful exchange of knowledge and experiences. Scientists presented latest research findings while farmers shared ground realities and challenges. The interactive format allowed for practical problem-solving and built lasting connections between farming community and research institutions.
objectives: Facilitate knowledge exchange between farmers and scientists
Address farmer challenges through scientific solutions
Build trust and collaboration channels
Demonstrate latest agricultural technologies

facilitators.name: Dr. Ramakrishnan P.
facilitators.title: Senior Scientist, Krishi Vigyan Kendra
facilitators.bio: 30 years in agricultural research and farmer extension services

requirements.prerequisites: Active farmers or those interested in farming

logistics.transportation: Located on main road, bus facility available

events.cancellationPolicy: Free event - contact organizers for changes
